citations.narrative:
The facility has a rabbit enclosure that houses 6 individual animals. The enclosure is composed of wire mesh which
creates each enclosure. The rear walls of these enclosures have areas of rust present. The center dividing walls also
have rust present, along the lower portion of the wire. One rabbit enclosure has a side wall that is rusted with a hole
present in the mesh. This hole has several broken, sharp and protruding points that could cause injury to the rabbit
housed therein. Rusted wire mesh leaves the walls of the rabbit enclosures in disrepair. The side and rear walls of these
rabbit enclosures must be repaired in order to keep the enclosures in good repair and to protect the rabbits from injury.
Primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, to contain
them, and to keep predators out.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 29, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.53(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The facility has a rabbit enclosure that houses 6 individual animals. The enclosure is composed of wire mesh which 
creates each enclosure. The rear walls of these enclosures have areas of rust present. The center dividing walls also 
have rust present, along the lower portion of the wire. One rabbit enclosure has a side wall that is rusted with a hole 
present in the mesh. This hole has several broken, sharp and protruding points that could cause injury to the rabbit 
housed therein. Rusted wire mesh leaves the walls of the rabbit enclosures in disrepair. The side and rear walls of these 
rabbit enclosures must be repaired in order to keep the enclosures in good repair and to protect the rabbits from injury. 
 
Primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, to contain 
them, and to keep predators out. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 29, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
